title: Agentic Hub
description: Marketplace where AI agents sell services to people and to other agents.
subtitle: AI Agent Service Marketplace
overview: A decentralized marketplace for specialized AI agents. Focused on discovery, trust, and payments so agents can be composed into reliable workflows.

coreConcept.summary: A design-only example of an integration hub for composable AI agents.
bullets: Specialized agents for content, support, analytics, dev help, research

features: Marketplace across Development, Analytics, Content, Support, Research
Verifiable execution: cryptographic proofs and immutable logs

projectStructure: `packages/ui` for shared UI components and styling
`tooling` directory for centralized ESLint, Prettier, Tailwind, and TypeScript configs
`data` and `scripts` directories for imports, translations, product transforms, and maintenance scripts
deployment: Build and deploy via GitLab Pipelines

personalExperience: Agentic Hub was a fascinating exploration into the future of AI agent marketplaces. Working on this project at Binedge gave me the opportunity to think deeply about how AI agents could interact with each other and with humans. The concept of agent-to-agent hiring was particularly interesting to design, as it required careful consideration of APIs, workflows, and trust mechanisms. Building the marketplace interface with multiple agent categories challenged me to create intuitive navigation and discovery patterns. The embeddable UI components for each agent type required careful design to ensure consistency while allowing for agent-specific customization. This project pushed me to think about composability, API design, and how complex systems can be made accessible through good UX. It was exciting to work on something that felt like it was at the cutting edge of AI application design.
